title: A Voyage round Great Britain; with short views of Aberdeen, Balmoral, ... Fécamp, Havre and Paris
author: Hargreaves, Thomas
snippet: There are a greatnumber of very old houses, showing the date of theirerection over the doors in something like the following manner : '16AB + MB 32," I7"RH + ML52,''RSI V 1738,' ' 17 IM + ID48.' There are threechurches—the Established Church, a new edificeerected in 1833 (the old church previously in usebeing now in ruins), the Free Church, and theUnited Presbyterian Church ; the two latter joininghands in opposition to the Established Church, thecommon battle ground being on the School Board. The ruins of the old church are very interesting, andthe tombstones in the graveyard worthy of examination, some dating back 300 or 400 years.
